{TUXFORD LIBRARY (THE OLD GRAMMAR {SCHOOL) by Sarah Cook
The second oldest building is the library (l669). A man called Charles Read built three schools. The first head teacher was Mr. Charlesworth, the vicar. But it was only for boys because they thought that girls were thick{BUT WE'RE NOT.}The School was closed down in l9l5. After that it became a clinic. Between l95O - 58 it was used by the Tuxford Primary for a extra classroom.
